quest.name: Lord of Levin
journal: Minfilia wishes to discuss the latest threat to arise in the Black Shroud.

According to Minfilia, the Order of the Twin Adder believes that the primal Ramuh has been summoned within the borders of the Black Shroud. The Antecedent bids you answer the request of the Elder Seedseer, and offer your aid to the people of the forest. Travel to Gridania and report to Serpent Commander Vorsaile Heuloix at the Adders' Nest.

Serpent Commander Heuloix seems much relieved at your arrival. Though eager for you to begin your mission, he asks that you first meet with Kan–E–Senna at the Lotus Stand to discuss diplomatic alternatives. Speak with the silent conjurer at Nophica's Altar to gain admission.

The Elder Seedseer confirms that the primal Ramuh has indeed been summoned forth by the natives of the Sylphlands. Loath to sacrifice the hard-won peace with the sylphs, she asks that you attempt to parley with the Lord of Levin before resorting to force. Travel to Little Solace in the East Shroud and report to the serpent lieutenant who will brief you on how to proceed.

After welcoming you to Little Solace, the serpent lieutenant informs you that an investigation is already underway to determine where the primal Ramuh might be found. Bide your time until such time as the report is delivered, then speak with the lieutenant once more.
objectives: Speak with Vorsaile Heuloix at the Adders' Nest.
Speak with Kan–E–Senna at the Lotus Stand.
Speak with the serpent lieutenant at Little Solace.

dialogue.name: MESSENGER01447
dialogue.text: I am come on behalf of the Elder Seedseer to petition the aid of your order. The Antecedent has been apprised of the situation.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thank you for responding to my call with such haste.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Rest assured, I should not have summoned you were it not urgent. To business, then: I have received some most disturbing news from the Order of the Twin Adder. They have reason to believe that the sylphs may have called forth their revered guardian─the primal Ramuh.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, “may have”? Then it is not certain?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: The Elder Seedseer informs us that the elementals themselves murmur of the Lord of Levin's return to the forest. The Sylphlands, however, display no signs of undue commotion.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Antecedent, but that fact need not contradict the elementals' testimony. Unlike his more bellicose compeers─Garuda and so on─Ramuh is reputed to act only in the defense of his children.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: I imagine he would soon make his presence known if any were foolish enough to directly endanger the sylphs or their territory.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The abruptness of this development concerns me. Were we not keeping a close watch on the “touched ones” and their movements?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If preparations for a summoning ritual were indeed underway, 'twould surely not have escaped your notice.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Oh, it didn't. I was pretty sure it was going to happen─just not this soon.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I beg your pardon? You foresaw this eventuality and did naught to prevent it!?

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: I-I told Papalymo! I suppose I could have reported things to Minfilia earlier...but there honestly wasn't much we could do except wait and see.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: You know how the sylphs feel about people poking around in their territory.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: They already summoned Ramuh once right after the Calamity, but that was because the Garleans came tramping through the forest...

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: ...And so long as Castrum Oriens stands, the sylphs cannot be blamed for wishing to have their guardian deity on hand.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: In short, Yda and I are in agreement. The actions of the forest folk were inevitable and unavoidable.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: And I maintain that observation would have remained the best policy had it not been for the sudden influx of strangers into the Black Shroud. That, alas, we did not foresee...

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: By all accounts, the recent violence in Ul'dah drove a number of refugees to seek safety under the concealing canopy of the trees.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: 'Tis like that the sylphs perceived this panicked migration as yet another invasion, and quickened their efforts to summon their god.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I am put in mind of Titan and the kobolds. Once again, it is the affairs of men which have paved the way for a primal's coming.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Indeed. One cannot help but wonder what manner of place Eorzea would be without the “civilizing influence” of mankind... Be that as it may, this regrettable development does afford us a unique opportunity.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Forename─through your dealings with the sylphs of Little Solace, you once succeeded in preventing an untimely conflict with Gridania.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: I wonder...might one who has treated with the sylphs so fruitfully in the past not achieve similar success with their patron deity?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: If Ramuh can be convinced of our intentions, it may be the first step to breaking the cycle of primal summoning.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...A fond hope. Were such a thing possible, we would not have been at war with the beastmen since time immemorial.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: But maybe this time we can─

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Let us continue this discussion anon. We must needs first consult with the nation most affected by Ramuh's presence.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: The Elder Seedseer has requested your personal involvement, Forename. Pray report to Commander Heuloix at the Adders' Nest as soon as you are able.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Steel yourself for the worst. While I hope for a peaceful resolution to this matter, experience suggests that your meeting with the Lord of Levin will prove less than amicable. In such an event, your fellow Scions will of course lend you whatever support you require.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: The Elder Seedseer has asked for you by name. Pray report to Commander Heuloix at the Adders' Nest in Gridania with all haste.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Forename of the Scions[GC Rank] Surname, your arrival has been most anticipated. The appearance of a primal is ever cause for alarm and unease.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Though my men stand ready for any eventuality, I know of none more qualified than you to snuff out this threat. Indeed, I would have you do so without delay. The Elder Seedseer, however, would speak with you first.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: She is of the opinion that your diplomatic─rather than martial─skills may better serve our cause. I will leave further explanation to our learned leader. Pray make your way to Nophica's Altar. The conjurer in attendance will admit you to the Lotus Stand.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: The Elder Seedseer wishes to speak with you ere you confront the Lord of Levin. Pray make your way to Nophica's Altar, and a conjurer will admit you to the Lotus Stand.

dialogue.name: DOORMANLOTUS
dialogue.text: The other Scions have already arrived, madamsir. May I show you in?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Lotus Stand?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Whatever the Elder Seedseer is planning, I want you to know that I'll be right there by your side. And I'm sure Y'shtola won't be far behind─even if she does think everything's mankind's fault!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: It is said that once Ramuh passes judgment, his wrath is implacable. 'Twould be best to conclude this discussion ere Gridania and its people are placed upon his scales.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I see the sylphs have sent their own representative. There can be no doubt, then...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I am most curious to hear how the Elder Seedseer means to treat with Lord Ramuh.

dialogue.name: SYLPH01448
dialogue.text: Oh! Hello, walking one! It is good to see a friend of elder one!

dialogue.name: DOORMANLOTUS
dialogue.text: Your meeting with the Elder Seedseer is concluded? Then I wish you good fortune in your task.

dialogue.name: LIEUTENANT01448
dialogue.text: Forename of the Scions[GC Rank] Surname? I was told to expect you.

dialogue.name: LIEUTENANT01448
dialogue.text: I understand you go to treat with the primal Ramuh himself─an unenviable task, but one for which I have no doubt you are well suited.

dialogue.name: LIEUTENANT01448
dialogue.text: I have been told that your fellow Scions are conducting an investigation of the area as we speak, that we might ascertain the location where the Lord of Levin might be found. I would ask that you abide here until they return with their findings.
